channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree roots lifting pavement and spreading, 22nd August
item.description:
Tree roots of overgrown tree lifting pavement and spreading towards property at 92 vener road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 92, Venner Road, Penge, London

item.title: Redundant sign obscures visibility for turning traffic, 22nd August
item.description:
Please remove signage no longer required, it obstructs view for traffic coming out of Rosemont Ave.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 691, High Road, North Finchley, London

item.title: Constant bad smell near rubbish bins, 22nd August
item.description:
Bins around the corner create a constant bad smell. Pavement needs to be washed and cleaned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 261-271, Regent Street, Mayfair, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Stripped Bikes, 22nd August
item.description:
These bikes have been here for almost a year now and are breaking apart into pointy shards of metal. You'd better remove them before someone does themselves an injury!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Golden Square, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose bollard in the street, 22nd August
item.description:
A black and white bollard has been knocked down and is now laying loose in the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Cavendish Square, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple dog and fox excrement on Dunlace Road, 22nd August
item.description:
Multiple dog and fox excrement on Dunlace Road on the section between 1-52 Dunlace Road. Literally 10-20 fouling ms. It’s not cleaned up ever. Even though the street is swept it is not cleaned up. It’s been there for weeks
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Dunlace Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish everywhere, 22nd August
item.description:
The overflowing bins are creating a hazard with flies & food, & environmental issues with plastic bottles ending up on the beach & river. This is Friday & has been ongoing for over a week. It is unacceptable going into the bank holiday weekend with day trippers arriving in.large numbers.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mudlarks Boulevard, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike in Pymmes Brook, 22nd August
item.description:
A Lime bike has, somehow?, been thrown over the fence into Pymmes Brook in Tile Kiln Lane, N13. It seems to have been there quite a while

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tile Kiln Lane, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Smelly drains, 22nd August
item.description:
Intermittent drainage smell can be experienced in the main lobby area of 39- 42 New Bond Street- internal stack pipe and drainage clearance has taken place
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15a, Grafton Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on property, 22nd August
item.description:
The graffiti has been at the front of this building for 2 months and needs to be removed. This building is owned by Hackney and this was previously reported but Hackney has not addressed this!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stamford Hill, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A Fly-tip Large - More than 10 black bags problem has been found, 22nd August

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Canterbury Terrace, London

item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load (Estates)

item.title: Nitrous oxide cannisters, 22nd August
item.description:
All along the pavement on the North side of Tile Kiln Lane opposite Oakthorpe Primary School there are gas cylinders thrown there. Some have been thrown over the fence onto the bank of Pymmes Brook. The previous ones reported recently were cleared but there are more now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tile Kiln Lane, Bowes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building material, 22nd August
item.description:
People dumped this outside of our house with a sign "please do not remove". Bloody cheek!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Glading Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uncolleted rubish, 22nd August
item.description:
Uncolleted rubish for more than a week

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Margaret Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Union Jack flags attached to council/highway authority property, 22nd August
item.description:
These have been attached to lamp posts at each end of Fairford Avenue, Barnehurst Avenue and the ABC roads in close proximity to primary schools. Suspect this is not innocent patriotism, but intended to be exclusionary as they are encouraged by the likes of Tommy Robinson, and the actual/intended effect is that they are likely to make some members of our communities feel uncomfortable. Request that they should be removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downbank Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping - large pile of rubbish., 22nd August
item.description:
Flytipping - large pile of rubbish. Please could it be removed. It has been there for a while. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Joan Crescent, Middle Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Whole local area - street cleansing not done each week and reports closed down with no action, 22nd August
item.description:
The street cleansing in this WHOLE AREA is not done weekly as it should be and frequently reports are closed down as completed with no action taken, can it please be ensured that street cleansing occurs properly and then there will also be fewer reports of litter as it has already been picked up, issue for years
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Havelock Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
